DOC.brief_title: Efficacy Safety Sodium Alginate Oral Suspension Treat Non-erosive Gastro-esophageal Reflux Disease
DOC.detailed_description: This multi-center , double blind , randomize trial aim compare efficacy safety profile sodium alginate oral suspension ( 50 mg/ml ) 20 ml three time daily omeprazole ( 20 mg/capsule ) 1 capsule daily treatment non-erosive reflux disease ( NERD ) patient Taiwan . Patients include study diagnose NERD ; heartburn regurgitation ( either one ) main symptom least 2 day week present ≧1 month screening ; heartburn regurgitation ( either one ) 7 day screen period , either frequency ≧4 day mild symptom , ≧ 2 day moderate severe symptom ; sign informed consent . Patients exclude diagnosed erosive gastroesophageal reflux disease ( GERD ) , Barrett 's esophagus esophageal stricture ; active heal gastroduodenal ulcer ( except scar ) ; history gastric , duodenal esophageal surgery ; intrahepatic stone , gallstone , gallbladder sludge , hepatic pancreatic carcinoma evidence abdominal ultrasonography , ischemic heart disease evidence electrocardiogram ; take proton pump inhibitor ( PPI ) within 14 day screen , H2-blocker , prokinetic agent antacid within 7 day screen ; clinically significant liver kidney disease . The primary efficacy endpoint percentage patient achieve adequate heartburn ( define burn feeling pain behind breast bone ) regurgitation ( defined acid taste mouth unpleasant movement material upwards stomach ) relief day 28 assess patient diary . The secondary efficacy endpoint percentage patient achieve adequate heartburn regurgitation relief day 14 ; change baseline reflux disease questionnaire total score day 14 & 28 ; patient ' overall satisfaction end study ; number antacid use 4-week treatment period . The safety endpoint incidence adverse event , change laboratory test result ( hematology , biochemistry , urinalysis ) . The study hypothesis treatment sodium alginate non-inferior omeprazole relieve heartburn regurgitation symptom NERD patient .
